commander.name: Generalleutnant Erwin Rommel
commander.notes: Appointed commander of Afrika Korps by Hitler on 6 February 1941

chief_of_staff.name: Unknown
chief_of_staff.notes: Corps staff established in Tripoli February 1941

staff_strength.notes: Small corps staff in Q1 1941 - expanded later

heavy_tanks.notes: No heavy tanks in DAK until 1942

Panzer II Ausf F.notes: North Africa variant with improved armor

tanks.notes: All tanks assigned to 5. leichte Division. Ship Leverkusen fire lost 10x Pz.III + 3x Pz.IV before landing. By April only 25 operational due to sand filter issues.
tanks.source: Lexikon der Wehrmacht - Panzer-Regiment 5, Osprey Men-at-Arms #53

halftracks.notes: Limited halftrack allocation in Q1 1941 for DAK

field_artillery.notes: Corps artillery limited in Q1 - primarily divisional assets

2cm FlaK 30.notes: Light AA, effective against ground targets

8.8cm FlaK 18.notes: Legendary dual-purpose gun, devastating against tanks

fighters.notes: No organic air assets - Luftwaffe support via Fliegerführer Afrika (separate command)

supply_status.notes: Building up supply infrastructure in Tripoli, extended supply lines across Libya

subordinate_units.notes: Only division in DAK during Q1 1941. Arrived Tripoli piecemeal February-March 1941

corps_level_assets.notes: In Q1 1941, DAK was essentially 5. leichte Division with small corps headquarters. No separate corps-level combat units deployed yet. 15. Panzer Division began arriving April 1941 (Q2), not present in Q1.
corps_level_assets.corps_troops_notes: Minimal corps overhead in Q1 - expanded significantly by Q2 1941

tactical_doctrine.role: Mobile armored spearhead for German-Italian operations in Libya
special_capabilities: Rapid movement and exploitation in desert terrain
Aggressive offensive operations despite supply constraints
tactical_innovations: Integration of 88mm FlaK guns in anti-tank role
known_issues: Extended supply lines from Tripoli (600+ km to frontline by March)
Sand filter problems reducing tank operational readiness
3.7cm PaK 36 inadequate against British Matilda tanks
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Tropical uniforms, water discipline, sand filters (initially problematic), dust protection for weapons and vehicles

scenario_suitability: First Battle of El Agheila (24 March 1941)

historical_context.formation_background: Formed by Hitler's order on 6 February 1941 to prevent complete Italian collapse in North Africa. Initially designated as Sperrverband (blocking force) to prevent further British advances in Libya.
historical_context.deployment: First elements (5. leichte Division) began arriving Tripoli 11 February 1941. Full divisional deployment completed by mid-March 1941.
historical_context.strategic_mission: Originally limited to defensive operations to stabilize Italo-German front in Libya. Rommel exceeded orders by launching offensive operations starting 24 March 1941.
historical_context.composition_evolution: Q1 1941: Only 5. leichte Division. Q2 1941: Added 15. Panzer Division (arriving April). Q3 1941: 5. leichte redesignated 21. Panzer-Division (1 August 1941).
key_operations: Initial deployment to Tripoli (11 Feb - 15 Mar 1941)
First offensive at El Agheila (24 March 1941)
Advance through Cyrenaica (March-April 1941, extends into Q2)

source: Lexikon der Wehrmacht - Deutsches Afrikakorps organizational history
Tessin Band 02 - Afrika Korps formation details
known_gaps: Some corps HQ staff details incomplete
Exact arrival dates of specific units within February-March 1941 window
15. Panzer Division NOT included (arrived April 1941, Q2)
Corps-level artillery and support units minimal in Q1 - expanded in Q2
validation.aggregation_status: mixed - Corps totals derived from 5. leichte Division data plus small corps HQ element
critical_notes: DAK in Q1 1941 was essentially 5. leichte Division with small corps staff
15. Panzer Division began arriving April 1941 (Q2), NOT present in Q1
Rommel appointed 6 February 1941, first elements arrived Tripoli 11 February
Corps strength reflects single division plus ~160 corps HQ personnel
All combat equipment assigned to 5. leichte Division in Q1

source_citations.source: Osprey Men-At-Arms #53, multiple Wehrmacht historical records
source_citations.notes: Hitler's order to form Afrika Korps
Appointed by Hitler, took command 6 February 1941
15. Panzer Division arrived April 1941 (Q2), not Q1
First elements of 5. leichte Division arrived Tripoli
Corps totals = Division totals + small corps overhead
Original mission was defensive, Rommel exceeded orders by attacking

extraction_metadata.extraction_method: Autonomous document_parser agent using Osprey Men-At-Arms #53 and existing 5. leichte Division JSON
sources_consulted: Osprey Men-At-Arms #53: Rommel's Desert Army (primary source)
extraction_metadata.data_completeness: 85% - Core structure confirmed, some HQ details estimated
next_steps: Identify Chief of Staff name if sources available
Extract Q2 1941 data showing 15. Panzer Division addition
Research Fliegerführer Afrika air support organization
